units.title: Seed AF cells in Matrigel and culture in generic epithelial medium
units.text: To investigate formation of AFOs we seeded viable AF cells in Matrigel droplets and cultured them in an ad hoc-defined generic epithelial medium without tissue-specific signals (Supplementary Table 3).
units.rationale: Describes the initial seeding and culture conditions for organoid generation.

units.title: Pick, dissociate, and replate individual AFOs
units.text: individual AFOs were picked, dissociated into single cells and replated (Fig. 2a,b and d).
units.rationale: Provides a method for establishing clonal organoid lines.

units.title: Perform intestinal ring formation assay with SiAFOs
units.text: To investigate the potential of SiAFOs for tissue engineering, we performed an intestinal ring formation assay (Fig. 3i).
units.rationale: Outlines a functional assay to test organoid self‑organization.

units.title: Image organoid morphology using PC‑CT
units.text: We imaged two distinct organoid morphologies through X-ray phase-contrast computed tomography (PC-CT), confirming the applicability of the method for organoid characterization (Fig. 2e).
units.rationale: Specifies a imaging technique for structural assessment.

units.title: Immunostain for proliferation and apoptosis markers
units.text: Immunostaining confirmed cell proliferation (Ki67) and lack of apoptosis (cleaved caspase 3) within AFOs (Fig. 2f).
units.rationale: Provides a validation step for cell viability and growth.

units.title: Stain for epithelial and mesenchymal markers
units.text: We confirmed the AFO’s epithelial identity by staining for pan-epithelial markers (EpCAM, ECAD and pan-cytokeratin) and showing absence of the mesenchymal marker platelet-derived growth factor receptor α (PDGFRα).
units.rationale: Establishes lineage identity of the organoids.

units.title: Assess epithelial polarity by marker staining
units.text: Notably, AFO’s epithelium is polarized as demonstrated by basolateral integrin β4 (ITGβ4), apical F-actin and zonula occludens-1 (ZO-1)-positive tight junctions (Fig. 2g).
units.rationale: Confirms proper cellular organization within organoids.

units.title: Detect proliferation with EdU incorporation
units.text: 5-ethynyl-2'-deoxyuridine (EdU) incorporation indicated cell proliferation at the SiAFO crypt base (Fig. 3a).
units.rationale: Provides a quantitative assay for cell division.

units.title: Conduct bulk RNA sequencing of clonal AFO lines
units.text: We then conducted bulk RNA sequencing to investigate the tissue lung (n = 6), kidney (n = 4), bladder (n = 1) and placenta (n = 1; Fig. 1e).
units.rationale: Describes transcriptomic profiling to determine tissue identity.

units.title: Perform single‑cell sequencing of AF epithelial cells
units.text: Using single-cell sequencing, we investigated human AF epithelial cells (AFEpCs), highlighting that these originate from multiple developing tissues.
units.rationale: Characterizes cellular heterogeneity at single‑cell resolution.
